intro: Scabiosa tysonii, commonly known as the mountain sweet William, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular at the base and gradually widen into a five-lobed shape, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scabiosa tysonii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
